paragraphs.content: I lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.

paragraphs.content: Then said I, Whither goest thou? And he said unto me, To measure Jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then said I, Whither goest thou? And he said unto me, To measure Jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.

paragraphs.content: And, behold, the angel that talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And, behold, the angel that talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,

paragraphs.content: And said unto him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls for the multitude of men and cattle therein:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And said unto him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls for the multitude of men and cattle therein:

paragraphs.content: For I, saith the LORD, will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and will be the glory in the midst of her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I, saith the Lord, will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and will be the glory in the midst of her.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the north, saith the LORD: for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, saith the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the north, saith the Lord: for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, saith the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Deliver thyself, O Zion, that dwellest with the daughter of Babylon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver thyself, O Zion, that dwellest with the daughter of Babylon.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the LORD of hosts; After the glory hath he sent me unto the nations which spoiled you: for he that toucheth you toucheth the apple of his eye.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord of hosts; After the glory hath he sent me unto the nations which spoiled you: for he that toucheth you toucheth the apple of his eye.

paragraphs.content: For, behold, I will shake mine hand upon them, and they shall be a spoil to their servants: and ye shall know that the LORD of hosts hath sent me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, behold, I will shake mine hand upon them, and they shall be a spoil to their servants: and ye shall know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion: for, lo, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of thee, saith the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion: for, lo, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.

paragraphs.content: And many nations shall be joined to the LORD in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the LORD of hosts hath sent me unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And many nations shall be joined to the Lord in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto thee.

paragraphs.content: And the LORD shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Lord shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.

paragraphs.content: Be silent, O all flesh, before the LORD: for he is raised up out of his holy habitation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be silent, O all flesh, before the Lord: for he is raised up out of his holy habitation.
